channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Crypto soared in 2025 — and then crashed. Now what?
item.description: For most of 2025, cryptocurrencies such as bitcoin surged as President Trump vowed to make the U.S. a crypto leader. But now, a severe sell-off has sh...

item.title: Rideshare union rights, social media limits and other state laws taking effect Jan. 1
item.description: Every new year, public media reporters across the country bring us some of the new state laws taking effect where they are. Here are six in 2026.

item.title: Guides to help you tackle your New Year's resolutions
item.description: From building your strength to tackling credit card debt, NPR's Life Kit has a newsletter journey to help you tackle your New Year's resolution.

item.title: Congress failed to extend Obamacare subsidies. This Democrat says Trump can save them
item.description: Sen. Peter Welch, D-Vt., says he thinks the Senate can pass a "retroactive" Affordable Care Act subsidy extension, but "we need President Trump."

item.title: About 40 people are dead and 115 hurt in a fire at Swiss bar's New Year's celebration
item.description: Dozens of people are presumed dead and about 100 injured, most of them seriously, following a fire at a Swiss Alps bar during a New Year's celebration...

item.title: Social media fuelled Mamdani's rise. Can he keep the momentum as New York mayor?
item.description: To succeed in office he will need to keep his supporters engaged with day-to-day governing, experts say.

item.title: Rain soaks Rose Parade in California and snow squalls hit Midwest and Northeast on first day of 2026
item.description: Rained poured down on the iconic Rose Parade for the first time in 20 years. That was as flood warnings and evacuation orders in Southern California j...

item.title: What we know about the Switzerland ski resort fire
item.description: Several dozen people are presumed to have died in the fire at a New Year party in the resort of Crans-Montana.

item.title: Around 40 dead in Swiss ski resort bar fire, police say
item.description: A further 115 are injured, some severely, in a fire at Le Constellation bar in Crans-Montana ski resort, officials say.

item.title: NYC Mayor Zohran Mamdani inaugurated, addresses New Yorkers
item.description: Zohran Mamdani was publicly sworn in and addressed New Yorkers for the first time as the city's 112th mayor.

item.title: U.S. says China military drills near Taiwan "increase tensions unnecessarily"
item.description: Chinese war games​ around Taiwan "unnecessarily" spiked tensions in the region, the U.S. State Department said, calling on Beijing to "cease its milit...

item.title: Health subsidies expire, launching millions of Americans into 2026 with steep insurance hikes
Trump, in interview, defends his energy and health, offers new details on screening he underwent
New discovery may challenge theory Vikings built first Irish towns - researcher
item.description: Dr Dirk Brandherm and his colleagues have identified more than 600 suspected house platforms in the Brusselstown Ring.

item.title: Fire kills dozens at crowded Swiss Alps bar on New Year's
item.description: Police in Switzerland say a fire at a bar in the Crans-Montana ski resort area is believed to have left about 40 people dead and dozens more injured.

item.title: At least 6 reported killed during Iran protests over struggling economy
item.description: The deaths may mark the start of a heavier-handed response by Iran's theocracy over the demonstrations, which have slowed in Tehran but expanded elsew...

item.title: Trump says he underwent CT scan, not MRI, during October examination
item.description: "In retrospect, it's too bad I took it because it gave them a little ammunition," President Trump told The Wall Street Journal.

item.title: Two killed in clashes between protesters and security forces in Iran
item.description: Videos on social media showed cars set on fire during running battles as protests entered their fifth day.
